Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to adopt and the Governor to sign A 3723-B and S 3963-B, which would eliminate the current cap contained in the State Real Property Tax Law on State aid to the City for maintaining a system of improved real property tax administration.
Items.MatterName: Eliminate the current cap contained in the State Real Property Tax Law on State aid to the City for maintaining a system of improved real property tax administration (A.3723-B/S.3963-B)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to introduce and adopt, and the Governor to sign, legislation which would provide a procedure for the granting of an exemption from real property taxes to eligible property acquired by not-for-profit institutions from the date they take ownership of the real property.
Items.MatterName: Provide a procedure for the granting of an exemption from real property taxes to eligible property acquired by not-for-profit institutions from the date they take ownership of the real property.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the establishment of the Forest Avenue Business Improvement District in the Borough of Staten Island and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the establishment of such district.

Resolution concerning the establishment of the Myrtle Avenue Brooklyn Business Improvement District in the Borough of Brooklyn and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the establishment of such district.
AND SUCH OTHER BUSINESS AS MAY BE NECESSARY

Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to immediately introduce and adopt, and the Governor to sign, legislation which would provide an additional sales tax exemption week on all clothing and footwear costing up to $110 per item from September 7 to September 13, 2004, for a 31-block area between 30th and 36th Streets from Park Avenue to Tenth Avenue.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Tax exemption on all clothing and footwear for the week of Sept 7-13, 2004
